abstract public function fetch_array()
Fetches the results array (Both numeric and associative indexes) and increments the internal pointer.
abstract public function fetch_assoc()
Fetches the results array (associative indexes only) and increments the internal pointer.
abstract public function fetch_object()
A lot like fetch_assoc, however, an object (stdClass) is returned instead of an array.
abstract public function fetch_row()
Fetches the results array (numeric indexes only) and increments the internal pointer.
public function field_exists($form_name,
$name)
Checks to see if the supplied field is registered on the specified form.
abstract public function field_name($field_offset)
Fetches the name of the field corresponding to the field offset.

public function filter_exists($tag_name,
$callback)
Checks to see if the filter is registered with the specified tag.
private $filters
Contains all the registered filters to the specified tags.
Filters are much like hooks, except these simply allow you to make minor and much simpler changes to the system, by allowing you to change a value, such as a URL, page name, and so on.
abstract public function footer()
This is a method which the Implemented_Theme class must implement! 
This is a very useful tool which aids in the creation, and saving, of form information.
public function form_exists($form_name)
Checks to see if the specified form name is in use.

$callback)

The SMTP server hostname.
function htmlchars($str)
Encodes the supplied string with htmlspecialchars with ENT_QUOTES and UTF-8 as parameters.
function htmlchars_decode($str)
Decodes the supplied string with htmlspecialchars_decode with ENT_QUOTES as parameters.
The HTTP class allows you to access remote files on the Internet.
function http_curl_request($request)
This function completes the specified remote request using the PHP extension cURL.

$num_redirects =  0)

The HTTP version to use in requests, either 1.0 or 1.1

private $include_header
Whether or not you want to have the header included with the body of the retrieved file.
protected function init()
This is a protected method, which can be overloaded by the Implemented_Theme class, which can be used to add any required CSS, JavaScript, or what-have-you without hardcoding it :)
function init_core()
Registers actions which are default “features”, such as logging in/out, registration, and other such operations.
function init_func()
init_func initializes the the $func array which contains variable functions for handling strings to allow better language support.
